newsitem.title: FRANCE: Bank of France drains 3.9 bln Ffr at tender.
newsitem.headline: Bank of France drains 3.9 bln Ffr at tender.

text.p: The Bank of France drained 3.9 billion francs at a securities repurchase tender held on Thursday to allocate funds for injection into the money market on Friday.
It accepted bids for 44.2 billion francs in new liquidity, 3.9 billion less than the 48.1 billion leaving the market on Friday when a previous pact expires. The new pact expires on Aug 30.
The Bank of France said it allocated 13.4 billion francs to bidders offering Treasury bills as collateral, satisfying 3.5 percent of such demand.
